content:
OUT! BOWLED! Tanzim roars back on the next ball! Full and straight, Dushmantha Chameera swings hard to the leg side but misses. The ball cannons into the off stump and sends it cartwheeling! BANGLADESH WIN BY 16 RUNS AND LEVEL THE 3-MATCH ODI SERIES 1-1!
Dushmantha Chameera b TH Sakib 13 (31b 1x4 0x6)

DROPPED! My, my, my! Simply unbelievable. Tanzim had the opportunity to finish this match. Back of the hand slower delivery, outside off, Fernando looks to heave it over the leg side but is done in by the slower ball. Gets a top edge which goes miles in the air, just beside the pitch. The bowler himself runs to his right, settles himself under the catch but spills it! A single taken. 17 more needed from 8 balls.

Another slower ball, short in length, Asitha looks to slash it through the off side but misses. Tanzim thinks he heard a noise and skipper Mehidy goes for the review. UltraEdge is flat as a pancake when the ball is near the bat. No more reviews left for Bangladesh now.
Slower ball, on a length, Asitha Fernando swings hard but misses.
Full, outside off, Dushmantha Chameera backs away and hammers it towards long off. Trusts his partner and takes the single. 19 needed from 11 balls.
A full toss, Asitha Fernando heaves it through mid-wicket for a couple. The over started with a six but got a big wicket. 8-0-56-1 for Mustafizur Rahman now.
Low full toss, on middle, Fernando looks to work it to the leg side and sets off for the single but decides against it.
Slower ball, on a length, moving away, Asitha pushes but misses.
Full, around off, defended.

OUT! CAUGHT AND BOWLED! The Fizz strikes eventually and dare we say, it is the biggest wicket of the match! Full, on middle, Liyanage looks to work it to the leg side but is early into the shot. Gets a leading edge which goes straight up in the air. Mustafizur stutters a bit but steadies himself and gets across, nearly in fronf of the non striker and takes the catch. Bangladesh are cock-a-hoop while Liyanage is distraught. Departs for 78 (85) and the whole of Colombo stands up as one to applaud him off the ground. The fighting 58-run stand has been broken and Sri Lanka are 228/9, needing another 21 from 16 balls!
Janith Liyanage c&b M Rahman 78 (85b 7x4 2x6)

SIX! Ho ho ho! Is that a stamp of authority or what? Full and straight, on middle and off, Janith Liyanage comes forward and drives it straight back over the bowler's head. Initially, it seems like a mishit but as the ball gathers more air, the distance is covered as well as it lands beyond the sightscreen!
A full toss, outside off, Dushmantha pushes it towards cover. No one is running. Three dots to end the over but the damage was already done on the first 2 balls.
A full toss outside off, swinging in, Chameera looks to drive but misses.
Full and outside off, Dushmantha Chameera looks to play a drive without moving his feet and misses.
Around off, Janith pushes it towards cover for a single.

FOUR MORE! 50-RUN STAND IN 47 BALLS! A length ball, outside off, Liyanage jumps down the track and hammers it straight back. Tanzim tries to kick the ball away with his right leg but misses. The ball races to the fence and long on dives to his left. But he gets to the ball and ends up parrying it into the ropes! Liyanage moves to 71 (82) with his 7th four! 28 more needed from 22 balls.
FOUR! Slashed away! A short ball, outside off, Janith Liyanage uses the width on offer and crashes it over backward point for a boundary!

Down the leg side, Chameera looks to flick but misses and is hit on the pads. Mustafizur appeals but the umpire moves away. Chameera wants the single but is sent back. What an over - just a wide from it!
Fuller, ouide off, 110 kph, moving away, Dushmantha Chameera looks to drive but misses again.
Slower ball, around middle, DC keeps it down the wicket.
Full, outside off, Dushmantha drives it through cover but the fielder dives to his right to stop it.

So close to the leg stump! Chameera gets across to tuck the ball and Mustafizur bowls it outside leg. Chameera misses his tickle and the ball just about grazes leg stump. Liyanage at the other end asks the umpire about the wide but the reply is that the batter moved across.
Landed outside off, from the back of the hand, fuller in length, Chameera looks to drive but misses.
WIDE. Pressure telling on Bangladesh now. A short ball, down the leg side, Dushmantha Chameera looks to tuck but misses.
A slower one, short and around off, Dushmantha Chameera manages to drag it with a pull shot to deep fine leg for one more. Sri Lanka need 37 runs off the last five overs.
Short of a length and outside off, Janith Liyanage presses back and pulls it down deep square leg for a run.
Back of a length and outside off, Dushmantha Chameera hops and runs it down towards deep third for one more.
A yorker, around off, Janith Liyanage drills it to long on for one.

FOUR! A good effort goes in vain! Full and outside off, Janith Liyanage comes forward and drives it hard through covers. The sweeper cover fielder runs across to his right and puts in a dive to cut it off but makes a meal of it. Janith gets another boundary and now, Sri Lanka need 41 runs off 34 balls as 10 has come off the first two balls.

SIX! HOICKED! What a player he is! A fuller delivery, slower and around off, Janith Liyanage reads the slowness of the ball, uses his feet and gets to the pitch of the ball before smacking it down the ground over the wide long on fence for a biggie.

Another slower delivery, fuller and outside off, Dushmantha Chameera looks to play out this into the off side but gets beaten by the change of pace on it. Sri Lanka need 51 off the last six overs. This is getting interesting.
Short pitched, around leg, Janith Liyanage swivels on his toes and pulls it down to deep backward square leg for one.
Outside off, pushed down towards cover for one by Chameera.

A slower one, on a length and outside off, Dushmantha Chameera looks to push it into the off side but plays his shot a bit late as the ball comes late than he would have expected to be. Gets beaten on the outside edge.
Back of a length and outside off, Dushmantha Chameera stands tall and swings hard at it. Miscues his pull shot but gets enough to clear mid-wicket. Two runs taken.

Just short! But Janith Liyanage gets his fifty! What a fighting knock this has been! A slower delivery, full and outside off, Janith clears out his front leg away and looks to heave it across but gets deceived by the lack of pace on it. Gets a top edge that goes towards wide long off, where the fielder runs across to his left but the ball lands down ahead of him. He tries to bring his body to stop it but the ball goes through him and they take three runs, until the sweeper cover fielder cuts it off.
Another good yorker, outside off, Janith squeezes it to deep third for one. Sri Lanka need 58 runs off 42 balls now. The crowd is getting behind the batters and they are cheering for every run.

A slower delivery now, on a length and around off, Dushmantha Chameera is early in his shot as he looks to slog it. Gets it off the inner half of the bat and the ball goes in the air towards deep mid-wicket but falls down ahead of the incoming fielder. A single taken.
A yorker now, well-directed, and the ball is reversing, around off, Janith Liyanage manages to bring his bat down in time and jams it out towards mid on. A single taken.
On the fuller side and a bit outside off, Dushmantha Chameera comes forward and drills it to long on for one more.
Outside off, driven through mid off for a single.

DROPPED! Have you dropped the match, mate? A short ball, outside off, Janith Liyanage jumps down the track and slaps it towards point. Substitute Rishad Hossain leaps up but the ball bursts through his palms. Two runs taken.
FOUR! Bonus from Chameera! Overpitched, on middle, Dushmantha Chameera flicks it beautifully through mid-wicket and the ball races away! Boy, that would have made many a top batter proud.
A short ball now, pulled through mid-wicket for a single. 69 more needed from 49 balls.

FOUR! SLAP! A boundary after 32 balls! Overpitched, wide outside off, Janith Liyanage leans and crashes the cover drive. Sweeper moves to his right but cannot sweep it off! Liyanage moves to 41 with his 4th boundary.
And again! Perfect yorker, tailing in, around off, Janith gets his front boot out of the way and digs it out.
Excellent delivery. Definite reverse swing on offer, tailing in from outside off, on the yorker length, Liyanage gets his bat down in time to defend.
Full, outside off, Janith Liyanage thumps it but straight to mid off.
Full and around off, Dushmantha Chameera comes forward and defends it.

A yorker, around off, Dushmantha Chameera looks to jam it out but gets an under edge and the ball goes back to the keeper, who pouches it and appeals for caught behind. It is referred upstairs, and the third umpire checks the replays and calls it a bump ball as the ball has touched the ground on its way to the keeper. NOT-OUT comes on the screen and Chameera survives.
Nagging length and around off, Dushmantha Chameera hangs back and defends it to cover.
WIDE! Sprays it down the leg side, Chameera leaves it. Called a wide.
Hard length, over off, Dushmantha Chameera hops up, and drops it down into the pitch.
Fuller and around leg, Dushmantha Chameera looks to flick it but misses and the ball clips his front pad and goes back behind the wickets, where the keeper dives to his left and collects it.

A loud appeal for LBW, which is turned down by the umpire! Back of a length and around middle and leg, coming in with the angle, Dushmantha Chameera hops up and looks to flick it but misses and gets hit on the top of his front pad. Could be the height the issue.
Similar length, around off, Dushmantha Chameera pushes it through covers for one. Sri Lanka need 75 runs in the last ten overs.
Much full and around off, Dushmantha Chameera comes forward and blocks it out.
Dragged length and around off, Janith Liyanage turns it through square leg for one.
On the pads, flicked it to mid-wicket.
Touch short and around off, Janith Liyanage presses back and drags it with a pull shot to deep backward square leg for a couple of runs.
Nagging length and around leg, Janith Liyanage looks to defend it but misses and gets hit on the front pad.
A bit fuller and around off, Dushmantha Chameera looks to cut it but gets it off the outer half of the bat to backward point. Tanvir Islam ends his spell with the figures read, 10-1-39-5.
Full and around middle, Dushmantha Chameera comes forward and blocks it.
Nagging length and around off, Dushmantha Chameera looks to defend it but gets beaten on the outside edge as the ball turns away.

OUT! CAUGHT! A soft dismissal for Maheesh Theekshana and Tanvir Islam has a fifer now. He has bowled supremely well throughout the inning and has fought well for Bangladesh. Tossed it up and very full, similar line, around leg, Maheesh Theekshana comes forward and just chips it aerially to mid-wicket. He plays it with soft hands but fails to keep it down. The substitute fielder, Rishad Hossain moves to his right there and takes this sharp low catch in front of him. Bangladesh are 170/8.
Maheesh Theekshana c sub Rishad Hossain b Tanvir Islam 2 (12b 0x4 0x6)
An appeal for LBW but the umpire shakes his head! Full and on leg, Maheesh Theekshana looks to flick it but misses and gets hit on the front pad. The keeper says that it has pitched outside leg.
Slower through the air, full and around off, Maheesh Theekshana comes forward and defends it.
Flatter, full and around off, Maheesh Theekshana comes forward and looks to flick it but gets a leading edge which rolls away through cover point. A single taken. Sri Lanka need 79 runs off 72 balls.
Fuller and on the pads, Janith Liyanage goes across on his knees and sweeps it to deep fine leg for one.
Slower and on the dragged length, around middle, Maheesh Theekshana pushes it to long on for a single.
Nagging length and around off, Janith Liyanage knocks it down to long on for one more.

Tossed it up and around off, Janith Liyanage goes across and sweeps it uppishly to the left of deep fine leg. Janith calls for two as he sees Mustafizur Rahman getting a bit slow to the ball and completes two runs.
Full and around off, Janith Liyanage uses his feet and nudges it to mid-wicket.
Hard length, around off, Maheesh Theekshana comes forward and shows the full face of the bat to defend it. Sri Lanka now need 85 runs off 78 balls.
WIDE! Full but down the leg side, Maheesh Theekshana looks to tickle it but misses. Called a wide.
On a length and around off, Janith Liyanage pats it down to the left of backward point for a single.
Leg bye! Fuller and around leg, Maheesh Theekshana comes forward and looks to flick but misses. The ball clips his front pad and goes towards short fine. A leg bye taken.
Nagging length and around off, Maheesh Theekshana blocks it.

A bit fuller and down the leg side, Janith Liyanage looks to tickle it fine, but it seems to have hit the pad, and the keeper dives to his left but fails to hold onto it as the ball pops out off his gloves. Oh, the umpire has given it off the bat, and they take a single as the ball rolls away towards short fine. Could have been out if the keeper picked that catch.
FOUR! PICKED UP! A slower delivery, on a length and on the pads, Janith Liyanage hops up, and picks it up with a flick shot over deep backward square leg for a boundary.
Tossed it up and around off, Maheesh Theekshana clips it to mid-wicket. Sri Lanka need 93 runs off the last 14 overs.
Dragged length and around off, Maheesh Theekshana defends it off the back foot.
Fuller now and around off, Theekshana drives it to the left of the bowler, who stops it with his left hand.
Nagging length and around off, Maheesh Theekshana blocks it out.

OUT! CAUGHT! Finally, Bangladesh get a wicket and Sri Lanka are seven down now as Wanindu Hasaranga walks off. Tossed it up and around off, too full, Wanindu goes on his knees, also clears out his front leg away to get more access. But the ball is too close to his body and thus, he doesn't get the desired elevation. The ball goes high in the air and towards deep mid-wicket, where Tanzim Hasan Sakib moves to his left there and pouches it around his chest height. Bangladesh are 156/7.
Wanindu Hasaranga c TH Sakib b MH Miraz 13 (16b 1x4 0x6)
Tossed it up and around off, Janith Liyanage goes across on his knees and sweeps it aerially over leaping square leg for a single.
Back of a length, outside off, JL arches back and steers it behind point for a run.
Good stop. On a good length, outside off, Janith punches it through cover but extra cover dives to his left to make a terrific stop.

EDGED, SHORT! Slower ball, outside off, from the back of the hand, from around the wicket, Liyanage throws his bat at it and even gets an outside edge. But luckily for him, it lands short of the keeper!
On a good length, around off, 136 kph, Janith Liyanage stays leg side of the ball and pushes it towards point.
Outside off, punched towards cover.
Landed outside off, Wanindu Hasaranga pushes it through point for a single.
Around off, driven through mid off for one more.

Huge shouts for LBW! Extended appeals as well. But the umpire keeps his finger down and interestingly, Bangladesh do not review. An arm ball, around middle and leg, WH comes forward to defend but misses and is hit on the pads. That seemed to be going down the leg side to the naked eye. In fact, Ball Tracking confirms it to be pitching outside leg itself.
Around off, 83 kph, Janith Liyanage leans and pushes it through the covers for a run.
Around off, Wanindu stays leg side of the ball and drives it through mid off for a single.

FOUR! SLAP! 150 UP FOR SRI LANKA! And now they need 99 more from 100 balls! Hasaranga looking to change the momentum now. Full, around off, Hasaranga gets down on a knee and mows the slog sweep through mid-wicket!
Full, outside off, Wanindu Hasaranga reaches out and steers it wide of slip, to his right, for a couple.

FOUR! A boundary after 52 balls! Welcome relief for Sri Lanka. A short ball, around middle and off, Janith Liyanage initially ducks but at the last moment, ramps it over the keeper to the deep third fence! That's the first over which has gone for more than 6 runs since the 13th over!
No run.
Down the leg side, Janith Liyanage works it through mid-wicket for a couple. 109 more needed from 104 balls.
Fuller, around off, Wanindu allows the ball to come onto the bat and pushes this in front of point for a single. That's the first run after 9 straight dots!
On a length, outside off, slanting away, Hasaranga looks to play the drive on the up but misses.

Mustafizur Rahman is brought back on, as Mehidy attempts to change the pace again. But this could be a big gamble, with pace proving costly so far. On a length, around middle, Wanindu Hasaranga defends.
Landed around off, 90 kph, Liyanage stays back to defend. Ironic as might seem, this is the FIRST MAIDEN for Tanvir and just the second overall in this innings!
Landed around off, 83 kph, Janith Liyanage plays it very late, almost from the off stump, pushing it towards point. Sets off for the single but is sent back.
Shorter in length, JL stays back to punch it back to the bowler.

That's a classical left-arm delivery. Tossed up, outside off, slowness in pace, dipping onto the batter and then drifting away, Janith lunges to defend but the ball pitches and whizzes past the outside edge.
Around off, wide again, once again Liyanage reaches out to meet the ball, pushing it towards point.
Tossed up, wide outside off, Janith Liyanage leans to drive but gets an outside edge towards backward point.
Full and outside off, 92 kph, punched back to the bowler.
Outside off, 90 kph, a touch short, Janith Liyanage backs away and punches it through the covers for another single.
Full, around off, 81 kph, Wanindu stays leg side of the ball and drives it towards long off for one.
Slower through the air, 78 kph, around leg stump, Hasaranga stays leg side of the ball and jabs it towards short mid-wicket.
Outside off, a touch short, punched through the covers for a run.
Tossed up, on off, Wanindu Hasaranga comes down the track and works it towards long on for a single.

In the air...but safe! Tossed it up and around off, Wanindu Hasaranga is drawn forward as he goes for a drive down the ground. The ball goes uppishly to the left of the bowler, who tries to get his left hand there for a catch but the ball lands down ahead and goes to long off. They take a single.
Dragged length and outside off, Wanindu Hasaranga pushes it to cover.

OUT! CAUGHT BEHIND! Tanvir Islam has a four-fer and he has completely changed the game! Gives flight and pitches it full and around leg, as he sees the batter advancing. Dunith Wellalage skips down the wicket to negotiate the turn but gets undone by the leg line of the ball. He has to adjust his shot and stance and looks to field out this into the leg side. Gets an inside edge and the ball clips his front pad and lobs up beside the pitch behind the wickets on the leg side. The keeper, Jaker Ali quickly moves there and takes this simple catch. Bangladesh are 132/6.
Dunith Wellalage c J Ali b T Islam 1 (10b 0x4 0x6)

Nagging length and around off, Janith Liyanage comes forward to defend but gets beaten by the turn and only manages to get an inside edge. The ball goes through his legs to short fine and they take a single.
Slower through the air, full and around off, Janith Liyanage comes forward and defends it towards cover.
Around off, keeps it out towards cover point off the front foot by Janith.
A bit fuller and around off, Dunith Wellalage comes forward and drives it to cover. Just 5 runs in the last four overs.
This is some accurate bowling from the spinners of Bangladesh. Attacks the stumps and on a tempting length, Dunith Wellalage pushes it back to the bowler.
Full and outside off, Janith Liyanage slices it through cover point for one.
On the pads, nudged away to mid-wicket by Janith.
Turns back in, on a nagging length and around off, Janith Liyanage backs away and manages to keep it out into the off side.
Slower but on a dragged length and around off, Janith Liyanage chops it out to cover.
Nagging length and around off, Dunith Wellalage presses back and clips it to mid-wicket.
A loopy one now, full and around off, Dunith Wellalage gets forward and blocks it off.
Outside off, sliced away to deep point for one by Janith.

BEATEN! A slower delivery, on a dragged length and just outside off, Janith Liyanage goes back and looks to cut it but misses. The keeper catches it in the second attempt as the ball lobs up in the first out of his gloves and he appeals for caught behind but the umpire is unmoved. Bangladesh are getting exciting and for a reason as they are bossing the game right now.
Slower and short, outside off, Janith Liyanage manages to push it again to extra cover this time.
Nagging length and around off, Janith Liyanage goes back and punches it to cover.
Dragged length and around off, Dunith Wellalage goes back and punches it back to the bowler. A brilliant over from Shamim Hossain. Just one off it.
Tossed it up and around off, Dunith Wellalage pushes it towards cover, where Mehidy dives to his right and cuts it off.
On the pads, tucked away to deep backward square leg for one by Janith.

A massive appeal for caught behind from the keeper but the umpire shakes his head! Bangladesh have taken a review after considering that there is something touched when the ball has passed the batter. Darted in quicker and full, down the leg side, Janith Liyanage comes forward and looks to tickle it fine but misses and the keeper collects it to his left behind the stumps. Third umpire is called in and he checks the replays where it is confirmed that the ball has missed the bat and clipped the thigh pad on its way to the keeper. The on-field call stays.
On the pads, flicked but straight to square leg by Janith.
A bit fuller and around off, Janith Liyanage pushes it back to the bowler.
Similar shorter and around middle, Dunith turns it to square leg off the back foot. Just two runs and a wicket off this over.
Dragged length and around off, Dunith Wellalage comes forward and defends it into the pitch.
Floated up and around off, Janith Liyanage uses his feet and drives it to wide long off for one.
On the pads, knocked down to long on for one by Dunith.

OUT! CAUGHT! A soft dismissal for Kamindu Mendis and Tanvir Islam picks his third. On the shorter side and around middle, not a wicket-taking delivery, but Kamindu goes back and looks to chip it into the leg side for a single with soft hands. He fails to keep it along the ground, as the ball seems to be stuck in the wicket and comes later than he would have expected to be. The ball goes flat to the mid-wicket fielder, where Mehidy Hasan Miraz leaps a bit and takes it with both hands above his head. This is a big wicket and Tanvir is pumped up. Sri Lanka are 126/5.
Kamindu Mendis c MH Miraz b T Islam 33 (51b 2x4 0x6)
Tossed it up and around middle, Kamindu Mendis nudges it to mid on.
Nagging length and outside off, Janith Liyanage clips it to square leg.
A bit fuller and outside off, Kamindu Mendis slices it to deep backward point for one.

Dropped! A touch short delivery, outside off, Kamindu Mendis goes back and plays it very late to guide it towards third man. Gets an outside edge that goes pretty quickly towards the keeper behind the wickets, where it doesn't stick to the gloves of Jaker Ali. The ball rolls away towards backward point and Shamim Hossain can't believe his luck as he looks in distraught.
Fuller, on middle, pushed back to the bowler.
Around middle, flicked straight to short mid-wicket.

FOUR! JUST OVER! Fractionally short, outside off, Kamindu Mendis goes for the pull over mid-wicket. But the ball bounces a bit and hits the splice of the bat. Tawhid Hridoy leaps to his fullest stretch at short mid-wicket but the ball tips over, to the fence behind! Kamindu moves to 32 (45).

Full and around off, Janith Liyanage taps it towards cover point and wants to have a quick single but is sent back by his partner as the fielder is too quick there to get to the ball and throw it to the keeper. Right call. The fielder does not collect the ball though as Liyanage dives home.
A bit short and around middle, Janith Liyanage clips it towards square leg.

WIDE! Sprays it full and down the leg side, Janith Liyanage looks to tickle it fine but misses. The keeper collects it to his left behind the wickets and appeals for caught behind, more to distract the umpire. But it is given a wide.
Tempting length and around off, Janith Liyanage goes back and flicks it to mid-wicket.

FOUR! That will relieve the pressure! This one spins from middle, down the leg side, Liyanage does enough to get some bat on it, to just direct the ball to the right of short fine leg, for a boundary! 129 more needed from 159 balls now.
Tossed up, on middle and off, Janith Liyanage comes down the track and looks to flick but falls over while playing that shot. Gets a leading edge which goes along the ground towards cover.
Good early call. Landed outside off, 93 kph, Kamindu Mendis pushes it with soft hands into the gap at cover and calls his partner through for a quick single.
On the shorter side and around middle, Janith pushes it to mid-wicket off the back foot.
Nagging length and around off, Kamindu Mendis goes back and punches it to long off for a run.
Touch short, around off, stays a bit low as well, Janith Liyanage backs away and pats it down through cover point for one.
Carbon copy of the previous delivery.
The arm ball, around middle, from over the wicket, Janith Liyanage defends.
Full, outside off, 96 kph, Kamindu Mendis leans and drives it through the covers for a single.
Sliding on the pads, nudged away towards deep square leg for one by Kamindu Mendis.
Sharp turn! Floated up, around off, turns away with the arm ball, Kamindu Mendis is drawn forward into his defence and he is beaten on the outside edge.

FOUR! Boundary after 51 balls. Tossed it up and around off, Kamindu Mendis gets down on his knees and reverse-sweeps it towards deep third for a boundary to break the shackles. That's how good the spinners of Bangladesh have been in the last nine overs or so.
Outside off, 88 kph, Janith leans and presses this into the off side, between cover and point, for a quick single.
Fuller, around off, 83 kph, Liyanage lunges to keep it out.
Down the leg side, 84 kph, Janith Liyanage works it towards square leg.

Fuller and around off, Kamindu Mendis drives it straight to cover. The pressure is mounting as the boundaries have dried up, and even the singles are coming here and there, making it tough for the batters to rotate the strike with some good infield fielding.
Darts in full and around off, Janith Liyanage uses his feet and drills it to long on for one.
Nagging length and around middle, Janith Liyanage goes back and pushes it to mid-wicket.
The arm ball, outside off, Janith Liyanage punches it towards cover.
Outside off, Kamindu Mendis comes forward and drives it towards long off for a single.
A short delivery, around middle, tucked to the leg side.
That stays low! Outside off, Liyanage stays back to defend but the ball shoots low and somehow, Liyanage manages to keep it out!
Full, outside off, 86 kph, Liyanage lunges to block.
Around off, skidding through, short of full, Janith Liyanage goes back and defends.
Pushed towards long off for a single.
On middle, Kamindu comes down the track and works it towards short mid-wicket.
Down the leg side, Kamindu Mendis flicks it through mid-wicket and finds some open space to come back for the second.
Pushed down the ground for a run. 3 runs and a wicket from the over, Shamim Hossain's bowling figures read 3-1-6-1!
100 UP FOR SRI LANKA! 149 more needed from 187 balls. Outside off, fuller in length, Janith Liyanage leans and drives it through cover for a single to get off the mark.

OUT! CAUGHT! MAIDEN ODI WICKET FOR SHAMIM! The pressure tells and a mistake is committed! That is a team wicket. In Powerplay 2, the fielding captain is allowed to keep four fielders outside the 30-yard circle. But Mehidy chose to keep only three, making singles difficult for the batters to attain and the temptation of going over the top dangling. And the entire bowling unit has done well in cutting off both, boundaries and runs. Both, Asalanka and Kamindu tried to veer away from that temptation of going over the top, but eventually, Asalanka's patience wears off. A short ball, around middle and leg, Charith Asalanka looks to heave it over mid on but plays a bit too early. The ball hits the toe end of his bat and lobs tamely to mid on where Tanvir Islam takes it calmly. Asalanka departs for 6 (17) and from 75/1, Sri Lanka are now 99/4! Equation - 150 from 188.
Charith Asalanka (c) c T Islam b S Hossain 6 (17b 1x4 0x6)
Fired down the leg side, from around the wicket, very quick through the air, 97 kph, Charith Asalanka nudges it towards short mid-wicket.
Comes down the track and works it through mid-wicket for a single.
Full and around leg stump, Kamindu Mendis defends it down the pitch.
Full and straight, 92 kph, Charith Asalanka defends from his crease.
Down the leg side, 87 kph again, worked through square leg for a single.
Fourth dot on the trot. Around middle and leg, 87 kph, KM works it towards short mid-wicket.
Slightly slower, 87 kph, short of full, Mendis stays back and works it towards short mid-wicket.
Full and straight, the arm ball, 93 kph, Kamindu defends.
Full and just outside off, 88 kph, Kamindu Mendis gets a big stride to defend the ball towards cover.
Around off, punched down to long off for a run.

Pushed through, outside off, way quicker, 96 kph, Charith leans and pushes it uppishly. The ball lands short and goes away to cover's right, who dives that side but cannot stop the ball. A single taken.
Flighted, outside off, Asalanka leans and drives it towards cover.
Full and fast, around off, 84 kph, Charith Asalanka looks to sweep and gets it off the toe end of the bat towards short fine leg.
Around off, pushed down to long on for a single.
A bit of a round-arm action, from around the wicket, around off, pretty full, Kamindu Mendis defends into the leg side.
Down the leg side, Mendis gets across and nudges it towards square leg for a run.
Around off, pushed towards cover.

Full, around middle and leg, Charith Asalanka gets down to paddle but misses. The ball goes off his pads through square leg and the players go up in an LBW appeal but that seemed to be heading down the leg side. Additionally, as the batters take the single, there is no signal from the umpire. So might have been an involvement of wood.
Around off, solidly defended.
A touch short, outside off, 87 kph, Kamindu punches it to the right of cover for a single.
Full, around off, from around the wicket, Kamindu Mendis lunges and defends.
Tossed it up and around off, Charith Asalanka slices it towards cover point. Maiden from Shamim Hossain.
On the shorter side and around off, Charith Asalanka blocks it out.

Just short! A bit fuller and outside off, Charith Asalanka comes forward and pushes it on the up towards cover. The ball goes uppishly there and Mehidy Hasan Miraz dives forward but the ball falls short of him.
Nagging length and around off, Charith Asalanka defends it.
Dragged length and around off, Charith Asalanka pushes it to cover.
Darts in full and on leg, Charith Asalanka backs away, clears out his front leg away and looks to flick it but misses and gets hit on the pads. Half of an appeal there, but it is going down leg.

Flighted, full and outside off, gets a bit of turn, Kamindu Mendis is drawn forward as he looks to push it into the off side but gets a big outside edge. The ball goes past the keeper to his left and they take two runs. Short third chases it down.
Make it five! Nagging length and outside off, Kamindu Mendis gets on the front foot and punches it to cover again.
Four dots in a row! Full and around off, Kamindu pushes it towards cover.
Floated, full and around off, Kamindu Mendis takes a big stride forward and shows the full face of the bat to defend.
Full and around off, Kamindu drives it towards cover and wants to have a single but is sent back.
Tossed it up and just outside off, Kamindu Mendis comes forward and looks to drive it but gets it off the inner half of the bat back to the bowler.
FOUR! Thrashed through the covers! Lands it full and outside off, Charith Asalanka leans onto it and creams his drive through the gap at covers for a boundary to open his account.
Nagging length and around off, Charith Asalanka comes forward and drops it down beside the pitch on the leg side.
Fuller and again around middle, similar line, Kamindu comes forward and flicks it to deep backward square leg for one.
On a length and around middle, angling in, Kamindu Mendis takes a step forward and clips it to mid-wicket. He wants to have a single but is sent back.
Sprayed on the pads and on the fuller length, Kamindu Mendis goes across and flicks it through mid-wicket and instantly calls for two and completes it.
On a good length and outside off, Kamindu Mendis moves across and pats it down towards cover.
Nagging length and around off, Charith Asalanka defends it off the back foot.

OUT! LBW! Excellent review from Bangladesh. Flatter, full and around off, Kusal Mendis comes down the track and looks to flick but as the ball stays low, he plays the wrong line and misses. Gets thud on the front pad and there is a loud appeal for LBW from the bowler, but the umpire shakes his head! Tanvir convinces his skipper with the keeper to take a review! The ball has hit the pad very low, so this could be the reason. The third umpire is called in, and there is no need for the UltraEdge, as clearly there is no bat involved. Ball Tracking comes up with three reds. The on-field umpire has to change his decision, and Tanvir Islam is pumped up. Kusal Mendis walks off after a wonderful knock of 56 runs off just 31 balls. From 75/1, Sri Lanka are now 82/3, with both set batters back in the pavillion. Equation - 167 from 229.
Kusal Mendis (wk) lbw T Islam 56 (31b 9x4 1x6)
Fuller and around off, Kamindu Mendis skips down the track and flicks it towards mid-wicket, who fumbles in collecting the ball and lets it through himself. A single taken.
Drags his length back and keeps it into the stumps, Kusal Mendis goes across and turns it towards square leg for another single.
Similar flighted ball, full and around off, Kusal keeps it out towards the off side.
Flighted full and around off, Kusal Mendis comes forward and shows the full face of the bat to defend it.
Tossed it up, around middle, Kusal Mendis uses his feet now and knocks it down to long on for one more.
A bit fuller and around leg, stays a bit low as well, Kusal Mendis plays it off the back foot and adjusts his shot to nudge it towards mid-wicket.
Good single! Touch short and outside off, Kamindu Mendis cuts it down to the right of cover for a quick run.
Full and around off, defended back to the bowler off the front foot by Kamindu Mendis.
Much shorter and outside off, Kamindu Mendis presses back and punches it through covers. Tawhid Hridoy runs in to his left from deep cover and cuts it off. Two runs taken.
Dragged length and around middle, Kusal Mendis clears out his front leg away and swipes it to deep square leg for a single. The crowd is getting excited with his each shot.

Nagging length and around off, gets it to turn away a bit, Kamindu Mendis comes forward and looks to flick it and he close the bat face but gets a leading edge and the ball rolls away towards mid off. Sri Lanka are 75/2 after Powerplay 1.
Floated up and around off, Kamindu Mendis uses his feet now to negotiate the turn and pushes it back to the bowler.
Drops it a bit short and around off, Kamindu Mendis get squared up in playng through the line and ends up getting a leading edge towards backward point as he goes to defend it with a straight bat.

OUT! CAUGHT! Stop the press. Bangladesh have got a wicket. Well, a critic might say, this was extremely needless by Madushka. But spare a thought for the batter as well. Amidst all the ambience created by Mendis, it is pretty difficult to stay calm. Just a reminder, that is was Madushka who had got the ball rolling in this chase. But Kusal's lightning has stolen Madushka's thunder. Tossed up, outside off, Nishan Madushka jumps down the track and looks to go inside out but is not to the pitch of the ball. Gets an outside edge which goes high in the air, towards point. Tawhid Hridoy backtracks at point and takes it easily. The 69-run stand is broken and Sri Lanka are 75/2 after 9.3 overs. Need another 174 from 243 balls.
Nishan Madushka c T Hridoy b T Islam 17 (25b 3x4 0x6)
Full, a bit slower, around middle and leg, Mendis works it through mid-wicket for a single.
Landed outside off, skids through, Kusal Mendis defends.
Goes full and around off, Kusal drills it towards mid on, who dives across to his left and cuts it off. A single taken.
Oh, Mustafizur Rahman gets away now! On a length and around middle, a slower one, Kusal Mendis goes back and defends it.

FOUR! FIFTY FOR KUSAL MENDIS! Fourth straight boundary to get it in just 20 balls! What an inning this is from a class and talented player! On a good length and outside off, Kusal remains deep in his crease and opens his bat face very late to guide it through the gap at backward point for a boundary to bring his milestone. He takes off his helmet and makes a gesture towards the crowd and his fans.

FOUR! Hattrick of boundaries! On a length, outside off, slightly wider, Kusal Mendis actually tries to steer this towards deep third but gets it way too finer than he would have liked. The ball runs off the outside edge, but well of the diving keeper, to his right, and races to the deep third fence! The stand moves to 63 (39).

FOUR MORE! Off side, leg side, does not matter! This guy is looking unstoppable. This is not a bad ball by any means, as Mustafizur lands it on a length outside off. But under lights, both balls are skidding off nicely from the deck. That is making the balls travel faster to the bat and Mendis just punches it through the covers. Moves to 43 (18) with his 8th four!

FOUR! SLAM! That desperation gets even bigger now. A short ball, around off, angling away, Kusal Mendis transfers his weight on the back foot pretty quickly and pulls it through mid-wicket for a boundary! 188 more needed from 251 balls.
Nagging length and around off, Nishan Madushka punches it to cover.

Excellent effort from Najmul Hossain Shanto. Floated up and a bit outside off, Kusal Mendis uses his feet and looks to loft it inside out over covers, but gets it off the outer half of the bat, and the ball is sliced over the backward point fielder, Shanto, who tries to backtrack it. He goes after it to chase it down and puts in a dive forward to flick the ball inside the field. Gets up and throws it to the keeper to save one run for his side. Third umpire is called in to check whether it is a boundary or not. He watches the replays and confirms that he hasn't touched the boundary cushions while trying to flick the ball inside the field and calls that three runs. 50-RUN STAND IS UP!
Tossed up and around middle, Kusal Mendis comes forward and shows the full face of the bat to defend it.

SIX! Mendis is just taking a liking to the left-arm spinner! Flighted, around middle and off, hint of away turn, Kusal Mendis jumps down the track to go down the ground but is not quite to the pitch of the ball. But he still goes through with the shot and clears mid on and eventually, the ropes, with ease. Mendis moves to 32 (14). 50 UP FOR SRI LANKA and they now need 195 runs from 255 balls.
FOUR MORE! Overcompensation from Tanvir, firing this down the leg side, Mendis gets down on a knee again and sweeps it behind square leg for consecutive boundaries! The stand moves to 42 (32).
FOUR! PUMMELED! Tossed up, outside off, Kusal Mendis gets down on a knee, reaches out and mows a slog sweep over mid-wicket. One bounce and into the fence!

Hard length and around off, Nishan Madushka taps it towards cover point and wants to have a single. Kusal Mendis responds and takes a few steps forward but is sent back by Nishan as the backward point fielder gets to the ball with a slide and cuts it off.
Nagging length and outside off, Nishan Madushka stands tall and flat-bats it to mid off.

A full toss, around off, Kusal Mendis gets a bit surprised and only manages to drill it off the inner half of the bat towards mid on. A single taken but Mendis will think that he has missed out on this opportunity.

FOUR! POUNDED! Mendis has come out with a mood to take the bowling on. Similar to the previous ball and hence, the stroke is also the same. Only on this occasion, the pull shot is delayed slightly, but still, it is not met perfectly. The ball runs off the inner half of the bat but the timing is good enough to take the ball to the mid-wicket fence, between mid on and short mid-wicket. The stand moves to 33 (27).

A short ball, outside off, 129 kph, Kusal Mendis tries to take it on, looking to pull it over mid-wicket but is early into the stroke. The ball comes slowly off the surface and goes off the toe end of the bat, towards mid on.
On a good length, outside off, coming in with the angle, Nishan Madushka allows the ball to come to him and steers the ball with an open bat face behind point, for a single.

FOUR! Safe shot! Floated up and on the pads, Kusal Mendis uses his feet, gets to the pitch of the ball, and lofts it over mid-wicket for a boundary. Though the bat face gets turned in his hands during the connection with the ball, there is enough connection to clear the infield.
Fuller and on the pads, Kusal Mendis clips it to mid-wicket, who fumbles in collecting the ball properly but the batters don't take any run. The ball goes nowhere.
Tossed it up and around middle, Nishan Madushka stays leg side of the ball and drives it to long off for one more.
A touch short, outside off, punched straight to cover.
Down the leg side, helped towards short fine leg.
Full, around middle, watchfully defended.

FOUR OVERTHROWS! Tough luck for Bangladesh. Remember the great Kapil Dev's words around 2007, when he had opined that overthrows off deflection from the stumps should not be considered. Landed outside off, Mendis looks to punch but his bottom hand comes off the bat. The ball goes towards point. Najmul Hossain Shanto charges onto the ball from backward point, picks the ball up and has a needless shy at the bowling end. Hits the stumps directly but to his bad luck, the ball deflects towards the mid-wicket boundary. Well, the throw was needless, no argument, but shouldn't some consideration be given for direct hits, to encourage good fielding?
Correction from Mahmud, landing it full and just outside off, Kusal defends.
FOUR! Loose ball and punished. A bit too straight, on middle and leg, Mendis stands his ground and whips it over mid-wicket for his first boundary.
Outside off, punched straight to point this time.
This one also nips back in a long way, from outside off, Kusal Mendis looks to punch but is cramped for room and gets a bottom edge to the off side.

Good running. On a length outside off, jags back in sharply, Nishan Madushka looks to push it through the off side but gets a thick inside edge onto his pads. The ball rolls to the off side, beside the pitch and Mendis quickly calls him through for the single. The bowler joins the running race with Mendis and tries to cause an under-arm flick at the striker's end but misses. Would not have mattered as Kusal was easily in.
Around off, pushed through mid on for a single. 10 from the over. The costliest of the innings so far.

FOUR! Wow, this guy is looking in amazing touch tonight. A short ball, outside off, Nishan Madushka gets on top of the bounce, swivels, takes charge of the ball and pulls it behind square leg for the second boundary of the over!
Similar ball, Nishan is right behind the ball, leaning to meet the ball. Pushes this confidently towards cover.
Closer to the off stump, Madushka defends.
FOUR! CARESSED! Don't bowl over there. He will keep on driving you all day. Overpitched, outside off, Nishan Madushka comes forward and drives it gloriously through the covers.

Lovely length. Just short of full, Kusal Mendis is pushing forward to defend. But the ball pitches and bounces, nipping back in sharply. Goes off the top half of the bat towards deep third. A single taken.
Full and outside off, Nishan shoulders arms.
Outside off, dabbed to short third.

Wonderful riposte. On a length, outside off, Madushka looks to play inside the line and gets beaten, as the ball straightens and goes past the outside edge. The keeper, Jaker Ali, collects and straightaway celebrates for the catch but the bowler has heard nothing.
FOUR! PLUNDERED! Short and wide outside off, Nishan Madushka stands tall and punches it through the covers! 239 more needed from 285 balls.
Around off, solidly defended.
A short ball, outside off, Nishan Madushka slashes but misses.

OUT! LBW! Tell you what, Bangladesh will be honest enough to admit that they have got a lucky one here. On a good length, outside off, Nissanka stays back to work it to the leg side but the ball pitches and then shoots a fraction low, catching the batter in his crease. Nissanka is unable to adjust to the sharp shoot and misses his flick, getting hit on the pads. Tanzim appeals and for a while, it seems like the umpire will not give it out. But almost when the appeal is about to die down, the finger goes up! Nissanka takes the review, after a small chat with his partner and first up, UltraEdge detects no bat involved. Time for Ball Tracking. Clipping the outer half of leg stump! Umpire's call on hitting which means that the review will be retained but Nissanka has to go! Departs for 5 (8) and Sri Lanka are 6/1 after 2 overs! Need another 243 from 288 balls.
Pathum Nissanka lbw TH Sakib 5 (8b 1x4 0x6)
On a length again, outside off, decent bounce, Pathum rises with the bounce and punches it towards cover.
Fuller this time, pushed towards mid off.

FOUR! There is the first boundary of the chase! On a length, outside off, Pathum Nissanka punches it through the gap between cover and point, rising with the bounce, finding the gap and boundary. Farveez Maharoof on air remembers that this is the same way Nissanka got off the mark and also his century in the second Test. Amazing memory.
Outside off, back of a length, Nissanka punches it towards cover.
A quick short ball, around off, Pathum Nissanka goes for the pull but is hurried into the shot. Gets hit on the back of the bat and the ball rolls down on the off side.
On a good length, outside off, hits the bat hard, NM punches it towards point.
Slash and a miss. Fractionally short and wide outside off, Nishan throws his bat at it but does not move his feet and misses.
On a good length, outside off, moving away, Nissanka steers it towards deep third for a single to get off the mark.
On a good length closer to the off stump, Pathum Nissanka lets it go.
Ahhh... Madushka flirts with this one away from his body and gets a bit of an outside edge, which flies through the vacant gully region towards deep third. Takes the single.
Straightaway, some movement. Hits the deck hard, does Mahmud and bangs it on a length. Nishan Madushka dabs it straight to point.

OUT! LBW! Excellent review by Sri Lanka and Bangladesh have left 25 balls unused. A touch short in length, outside off, Mustafizur Rahman stays back in his crease to defend but misses. The ball lands and spins back in, catching him on the pads. Hasaranga appeals and extends the same, but the umpire is as still as stone. The keeper, Kusal Mendis, is confident along with his bowler and skipper Charith Asalanka signals for the review. Nothing on UltraEdge when ball goes past the bat, while Ball Tracking shows it to be hitting the top of middle and leg sticks. The decision has to be overturned and the 30-run stand has been broken. BANGLADESH BOWLED OUT FOR 248 IN 45.5 OVERS!
Mustafizur Rahman lbw W Hasaranga 0 (7b 0x4 0x6)
Outside off, another slog sweep, this time along the ground, to deep mid-wicket, for a single. This stand is now worth 30 (23).

SIX! Second one in the over and this is even better! The googly, around off, Tanzim Hasan Sakib gets right underneath the ball and swings it straight back over the bowler and the sightscreen! Moves to 32 (20) with his second six.
Outside off, Tanzim swings again, only to miss.
SIX! MURDERED! This won't improve Asalanka's mood one bit. Tossed up, outside off, Tanzim Hasan Sakib gets down on a knee and slog sweeps this over long on! Bangladesh touch the 240-mark!
Short of a length and around off, Tanzim Hasan Sakib hops up and pulls it down with soft hands to deep mid-wicket for a single to retain the strike.

Back of a length and around middle, seems to be a slower one, Tanzim Hasan Sakib is a tad early in his shot as he goes to pull it but the ball comes later than he expects. Gets it off the bottom part of the ball and goes into the pitch. The bowler collects it.

Bowls it full and around off, Tanzim Hasan Sakib clears out his front leg away and looks to heave it across but miscues it off the cue end of the bat to the right of long on. The fielder quickly gets to the ball but both batters take two runs.

Ouch! Short of a length and angling in, follows the batter, Mustafizur Rahman tries to sway away from it but gets cramped up for room as he goes to duck it. The ball follows and clips his helmet before going over the leaping keeper behind the wickets. They take a leg bye.
Hard length and around off, Mustafizur Rahman drops it down towards cover for no run.

Lands it full and around off, Tanzim Hasan Sakib drills it down the ground to the left of long off for a single. He wants to take another but is denied by a good throw of the fielder towards the keeper.
On the shorter side and around off, Tanzim Hasan Sakib drags it to deep mid-wicket for one and keeps the strike.

FOUR! Good placement! A googly, full and around middle, Tanzim Hasan Sakib gets down on his knees and uses his wrists to sweep it in the gap towards deep backward square leg, where the fielder covers good ground and puts in a dive to his right but makes a meal of it. Sakib gets another boundary.
Nagging length and aruond off, Tanzim Hasan Sakib pushes it back to the bowler.
Much shorter and outside off, Sakib punches it through covers and picks up two runs as soon as the sweeper cover runs across to his right and cuts it off with a slide.
Dragged length and around off, Tanzim Hasan Sakib presses back and pushes it to the left of the bowler, who stops it in his followthrough.
FOUR! SLOGGED! Tossed up and around off, Tanzim Hasan Sakib clears out his front leg away, goes on his knees and sweeps it in the gap towards deep mid-wicket for a boundary.

A big appeal for LBW from the bowler but the umpire is unmoved! Another well-directed yorker, around for, Mustafizur Rahman brings his bat down and looks to block but gets an inside edge onto his boots.
A slower delivery, back of a length and outside off, Mustafizur Rahman shapes up for an upper-cut shot but withdraws it in the end and decides to leave it.
A yorker, around off, Rahman squeezes it towards cover point.

Oh, just short! Fuller and around off, Tanzim Hasan Sakib remains deep in his crease and swings hard to go downtown. He miscues it off the bottom part of the bat and the ball goes flat towards wide long on, where Dushmantha Chameera runs forward, dives and tries to take the catch but the ball lands before him. A single taken.
Back of a length and angling in, around off, Tanzim Hasan Sakib presses back and flicks it through square leg but doesn't take a single.
Hard length and around off, Tanzim Hasan Sakib hangs back and punches it to extra cover.
Much full and around off, Mustafizur Rahman blocks it after covering his stumps.

OUT! Given LBW and Tanvir Islam takes a review after chatting with his partner! A ball that is a touch short in length, around off, comes in with the angle, Tanvir goes back and looks to flick it but gets too close to the ball and gets beaten on the inside edge. Gets hit on the front pad and there goes a big appeal for LBW and the umpire raises his finger. UltraEdge shows nothing and Ball Tracking presents that it is the Umpire's call on clipping the top of the middle stump. The on-field call stays and Tanvir Islam will have to go back. Bangladesh are nine down.
Tanvir Islam lbw W Hasaranga 4 (5b 1x4 0x6)
Full and around off, Islam keeps it out towards cover.
Much better! Full and just outside off, turns away, Tanvir Islam is drawn forward into his defence and he gets beaten on the outside edge.

FOUR! Good shot! Nagging length and just outside off, Tanvir Islam gets enough time to go back and picks the ball with a pull shot. The ball goes towards deep square leg, where the fielder even puts in a dive to his left but can't save the boundary.
Slower, full and around off, Tanzim Hasan Sakib clears out his front leg away and sweeps it hard but straight to deep mid-wicket for one.
Darts in a yorker, around off, Tanvir Islam brings his bat down in time and jams it out into the off side.

OUT! CAUGHT! Wicket number 4 for Asitha Fernando and this is quickly spiralling down now, for Bangladesh. A quick short ball, outside off, Hasan Mahmud goes for the pull but that proves to be his undoing. He is comprehensively beaten by pace as the bat comes through way after the ball kicks off. The top edge is induced and it is pretty meek. Goes only as far as the area near silly mid on. The keeper and short mid-wicket, both, go for the catch but the latter calls for it and Nishan Madushka takes it easily. Second wicket in the over and Mahmud departs for a 2-baller. From 204/5, Bangladesh have slipped down to 213/8!
Hasan Mahmud c N Madushka b A Fernando 0 (2b 0x4 0x6)
Full and outside off, hint of reverse, coming in, Hasan Mahmud looks to flick but gets a thick inside edge onto his pads.
Full and straight, Tanzim Hasan Sakib works it through mid-wicket for a single.

OUT! RUN OUT! Tawhid Hridoy is run out and he is furious, as he throws his bat on the ground. On a length and on the pads, Hridoy clips in the gap towards deep mid-wicket and runs the first one quickly and he calls for the second one. Tanzim Hasan Sakib responds and takes a few steps forward but then after seeing the fielder throw, he sends Hridoy back, but to that time, Tawhid was already halfway down the wicket. The fielder Nishan Madushka runs across to his left from deep mid-wicket and collects the ball very quickly and throws it to the non-striker's end, after seeing which batter is short of his crease. Hridoy tries to come back to his crease but the bowler Asitha Fernando collects the ball and whips the bails off, falling Hridoy short by a mile. He gets angry as that was his call for the second and he was the set batter, so Tanzim should have sacrificed his wicket if it was there. The umpire gives him his bat and he walks off. Hridoy departs after his fifty and Bangladesh are in deep trouble.
Tawhid Hridoy run out (Nishan Madushka / Asitha Fernando) 51 (69b 2x4 0x6)
Hard length and around off, Tanzim Hasan Sakib manages to push it off the bottom part of the bat to long on for one, as he goes for a flick shot.

FIFTY FOR TAWHID HRIDOY! Nagging length and outside off, Hridoy wait for it and cuts it in the gap towards backward point for a couple of runs to complete his milestone. His eighth fifty in ODIs and this has been an impactful knock from him, battling through cramps and excessive heat.

Similar length, on a tempted one and around off, Tawhid Hridoy punches it to the right of sweeper cover and instantly calls for two. The fielder moves across to his right and cuts it off but the batters complete two runs.
An arm ball, touch full and around off, Tawhid Hridoy goes back and pushes it to cover.

The arm ball now, around off, Tanzim Hasan Sakib pushes it back to the bowler. Wellalage gets across to his right to stop the ball bu collides with the non-striker who makes no effort to move. So Wellalage tries to stop the ball with his right foot but ends up kicking it away. The batters get the run then.
Shorter this time, around middle and off, Hridoy punches this down to long on for a single.
Slower through the air, from around the wicket, around off, Tawhid Hridoy defends.

OUT! Given LBW and Jaker Ali has taken a review instantly. On a good length and around off, coming in with an angle, Jaker Ali comes forward and looks to flick but gets beaten on the inside edge as he plays the wrong line. The ball goes through the gap between the pad and the bat and thuds onto the front pad. There is a big appeal and the umpire raises his finger. UltraEdge comes with no bat involved and Ball Tracking shows three reds. Jaker was suffering from cramps and departed after playing a good hand of 24 runs to make a useful partnership with Hridoy. Asitha Fernando strikes for the third time and Bangladesh are 204/6.
Jaker Ali (wk) lbw A Fernando 24 (40b 2x4 0x6)
Hard length and just outside off, Tawhid Hridoy gets top on the bounce and pulls it to deep mid-wicket for one. He wants to have the second one but is denied by a good throw of the fielder.
Fuller and angling in, on the pads, Jaker Ali lunges and knocks it down to wide long on for one.
Inside edge, safe! On a length, outside off, Jaker swings hard but only gets a thick inside edge which goes on the bounce, past the stumps, to the keeper!
Banged in short, outside off, 127 kph, Tawhid Hridoy gets on top of the bounce and pulls it all along the ground through mid-wicket for a run.
On a length, outside off, slower ball, Jaker Ali pushes it behind point for a single.

Much full and around off, Jaker comes forward and drives it towards mid off. Sets off for a quick single and though the fielder collects the ball quickly and makes a throw to the keeper, both batters complete it. Also, 200 is up for Bangladesh.
Quicker, dragged length and around off, Hridoy punches it through covers for one.
Fuller and around off, Tawhid Hridoy pushes it to cover off the front foot.
The carrom ball, once again Jaker plays this off the pitch and is squared up. Gets a bit of an outside edge towards point. A run taken.
Outside off, punched towards backward point for a single.

MISFIELD, FOUR! Landed outside off, Tawhid Hridoy goes back and opens the face of his bat at the last moment, getting it to the right of short third. The fielder at short third gives it a chase but then slows down, on seeing Pathum Nissanka race across to his left from deep cover. He lets it go, thinking that Nissanka will stop the ball but the latter dives over the ball and it goes through. Hridoy moves to 41 (58) and that is just his second boundary. The bowler is not impressed.
On a length and around middle, Hridoy comes forward and flicks it to deep mid-wicket for one more. He wants to have the second one but is denied by a good throw of the fielder to the keeper.
On the pads, flicked away to deep square leg for one by Jaker.
Hard length and around off, Tawhid Hridoy goes back and pulls it to deep mid-wicket for one.
Short, outside off, Ali punches it through cover for a single. The stand moves to 30 (46).

Good game awareness by Tawhid Hridoy. Full, on off stump, Jaker drives it straight back. The bowler tries to stop it with his right hand and just about gets some fingertips on the ball. Deflects it onto the stumps behind and appeals for the run out. Tawhid is seen sprawled on the ground and the Lankans start to celebrate. But the replay shows that Hridoy, who was backing up, actually slipped on his back and that actually helped him skid his bat into the crease! Just in the nick of time!
On a length, outside off, Jaker Ali looks to punch but gets a bottom edge, which goes past the stumps behind. Good take by the wicketkeeper, moving across to his left.
Nagging length and around off, Jaker rolls his wrists and bunts it to long on for one.
Fired in full but wide of off, just inside the tramline, Jaker Ali makes room and tries to reach out but fails to make any connection.
Short and around middle, Tawhid Hridoy goes back and pulls it to deep backward square leg for one.
Down the leg side, 100 kph, Jaker Ali works it towards short fine leg for a run.
Short in length now, around off, Hridoy bunts it down to long on for a single.
Full, on middle, Tawhid Hridoy flicks it straight to short mid-wicket.
Full, outside off, watchfully defended.

A short ball now, 137 kph, outside off, Ali goes for the pull but perhaps the ball comes slowly off the surface. Mistimes it through mid-wicket and long on gets across to his right, to cut the ball off. Two runs taken.
Full, outside off, Tawhid Hridoy comes forward and pushes this towards mid off. Takes off for a quick run.
Nicely disguised leg cutter, don't think Jaker picked this, but managed to bunt it down to long on for a single.

FOUR! Don't think Chameera will mind that. On a length, outside off, Jaker Ali has a hack through the line and gets it off the inner half of the bat. Luckily for him, it flies over short mid-wicket and races to the fence behind.
Full and straight, clipped to short mid-wicket.

Again, squared up. Carrom ball again, outside off, Jaker tries to read this off the pitch and goes back to defend. Is squared up as the ball pitches and moves away, to go off the outside edge behind point. A single taken.
Fired in at 101 kph, another carrom ball, on middle and leg, JA lunges and works it towards short mid-wicket.
Fuller, around off, once again Ali does not pick the line, looks to flick but gets a leading edge towards cover.
The carrom ball, around off, Jaker is squared up as the ball pitches and then moves away. Goes off the outside edge towards point.
Just outside off, stays low, Jaker Ali adjusts well to defend.
Full, around middle and leg, driven towards long on for a single.
Outside off, defended solidly.
Finally something different. A bit of flight and Tawhid Hridoy is down the pitch, easing the ball towards long on, for one more.
Short again, outside off, Jaker Ali goes back and punches it through the covers for another single.
A touch short now, outside off, the ball goes towards cover this time, off the punch, for one.
Outside off, cut through point again, for a run.
Full, outside off, punched through point for a single.
A leg spinner to end the over, Ali defends it awkwardly.
Another wrong'un, outside off, pushed towards cover. He fumbles but no single is taken.
WIDE. Attempted googly, but slipped down the leg side. Jaker cannot connect with his flick.
Outside off, punched through the covers for a couple.
FOUR! Neatly done. Very full, outside off, Jaker Ali gets down and outside the line, reaches out and sweeps it through square leg. Deep mid-wicket rushes to his right but cannot get there.
Down the leg side, worked through mid-wicket for a single.
Full, around middle, defended solidly.
Down the leg side, this time Jaker Ali stays where he was and works it towards square leg.
Full, on middle, 80 kph, JA stays leg side of the ball, exposes all his stumps and works it towards short mid-wicket.
Full and straight, Ali lunges to block again.
Comes in with the arm, Jaker works it to the leg side.
Full, around off, Jaker Ali lunges to defend.
On middle, punched down to long on for a single.
Fourth dot in a row! A loopy ball, on a length and around off, Jaker Ali drops it down towards cover.
A googly, full and around off, Jaker Ali comes forward and shows the full face of the bat to defend it into the pitch.
Much fuller and around off, Jaker blocks it.
Slower and on a tempting length, around off, Jaker Ali waits for it and defends it towards cover.
Fuller and on the pads, Hridoy comes forward and eases it down to long on for one.
Short and around off, Tawhid Hridoy clears out his front leg away and pats it down to cover point.
Nagging length and around off, Jaker Ali blocks it solidly.

OUT! CAUGHT! Asitha Fernando bags his second and Shamim Hossain is gone! Short of a length and around the right shoulder of the batter, Shamim swivels on his toes and looks to hook it. He throws his hands only and is not in a good position for that shot. Still, he goes through it and gets a top edge that flies to deep fine leg, where Janith Liyanage takes it around his waist height, falling over to his left after taking it. Hossain goes for 22(23) and Bangladesh are 159/5.
Shamim Hossain c J Liyanage b A Fernando 22 (23b 2x4 1x6)
A bit full and around off, seems to be a slower one, Shamim uses his feet and pushes it towards mid on, where the mid-wicket fielder cuts it off.
Back of a length and around off, Shamim Hossain stays on the back foot and turns it with soft hands to mid-wicket.
Short of a length and just outside off, Shamim Hossain sways away from it.

Hard length and around off, Tawhid Hridoy punches it towards mid off and sets off for a quick single. His partner responds and although the fielder gets to the ball and makes a throw to the non-striker's end, he misses. They complete the single.
FOUR! PUNISHED! Darted full and sliding on the pads, Shamim Hossain goes across on his knees and just sweeps it in the gap towards deep fine leg for a boundary.
Quicker, full and around middle, Tawhid Hridoy flicks it to deep square leg for one more.
On the pads, knocked it down to long on for one by Hossain.

FOUR! SLICED! Darts in quick and full, outside off, Shamim Hossain stays leg side of the ball and opens his arms very late to squeeze it through the gap between backward point and short third for a boundary. 150 UP FOR BANGLADESH! 135 balls left. Is 300 still on?

An appeal for LBW but the umpire shakes his head! Fuller and around leg, Shamim Hossain comes forward to defend but gets beaten on the inside edge. Gets hit on the front pad, but probably, could be doing down leg with that angle.
On the shorter side and around off, Shamim Hossain presses back and pushes it back to the bowler.
Back of a length and in that channel outside off, Tawhid Hridoy goes back and looks to pull it but gets it off the inner half of the bat to mid-wicket, who collects it on the bounce.
A slower knuckle delivery, full and around off, Tawhid Hridoy gets a bit of deceived but goes through his flick shot and gets it off the inner half of the bat to mid on.
Hard length and around middle, Tawhid Hridoy hops up and nudges it to mid-wicket.
Angling in, on the pads, on the fuller length, Tawhid Hridoy flicks it in the gap to the left of deep square leg and registers two runs to his name.
Back of a length now and outside off, Tawhid Hridoy stands tall and punches it off the middle of the bat but straight to cover.
Begins with a hard-length delivery, angling in, around off, Tawhid Hridoy goes across and clips it to mid-wicket.
Similar delivery, on the pads, Shamim tucks it to mid-wicket again off the back foot.
Dragged length and slower, around middle, stays a bit low as well, Shamim Hossain presses back and gets surprised at first but manages to keep it out towards mid-wicket.
Floated up and on the pads, Tawhid Hridoy comes forward and knocks it down to long on for one.
Nagging length and outside off, Hossain punshes it to wide long off for one off the back foot.
WIDE! Quicker and down the leg side. Called a wide.
Almost a yorker, around middle, Shamim Hossain backs away and manages to push it towards extra cover, who collects it to his right.
SIX! WHACKED! Tossed it up and a bit outside off, Shamim Hossain goes on his knees and sweeps it flat over the long on fence for a biggie.

Hard length and outside off, Shamim Hossain cuts it down to deep backward point for one, where the fielder makes a fumble in collecting the ball properly in the first attempt but the batters take only a single.

Oh, what a ball! A bouncer, directed well into the body of the batter, around middle, follows the batter, Shamim Hossain, tries to sway away from it but as he gets cramped up for room and falls over awkwardly. Luckily for him, it didn't touch anything and goes to the keeper.
Back of a length, on the top of the off stump, from around the wicket, Shamim Hossain rises with the bounce and taps it down to backward point. Shouts a 'No' to his partner for a run.

Excellent placement, good running. Down the leg side, coming in with the angle from around the wicket, Hossain just works it with the angle through square leg. Fine leg really races across to his right but cannot cut the second off.
A bouncer now, 136 kph, around off, Shamim ducks.
Full, outside off, from around the wicket, a nice compact defense from Shamim Hossain.
Well-fielded! A leg break, full and around off, Tawhid Hridoy comes forward and drills it back towards the bowler, where Wanindu quickly reacts and stops it with his left hand.
Nagging length and around middle, angling in, Tawhid Hridoy lifts his front leg up and drops it down to mid-wicket.
Tossed it up and around off, Shamim Hossain goes across on his knees and fetches out with a sweep shot to deep backward square leg for one.
Fuller, on middle, pushed through mid on for a run.
FOUR! A short ball, outside off, Tawhid Hridoy rocks back and cuts it through the covers for a boundary!
Down the leg side, Shamim Hossain tucks it through square leg for a quick single.
Another short-pitched delivery, around off, Tawhid Hridoy gets on top of the bounce and defends it into the pitch.
Back of a length and angling in, around middle, Shamim Hossain hops up and drops it down towards mid-wicket for a single.

OUT! CAUGHT! Dushmantha Chameera strikes and the Bangladesh skipper walks back! Short of a length, aimed at the body of the batter, Mehidy Hasan Miraz shifts his weight to the back foot and looks to hook it. He gets into an uncomfortable position as the ball gets an extra bounce, which he wouldn't have anticipated. The ball makes the connection with the upper side of the bat and goes towards deep backward square leg, where Pathum Nissanka moves across to his right and pouches it around his chest height. Mehidy goes for 9(10) and Bangladesh are 126/4.
Mehidy Hasan Miraz (c) c P Nissanka b D Chameera 9 (10b 1x4 0x6)
Slower delivery, on middle, Miraz defends. Mehidy bares a big smiles and indicates to his partner that he picked the change in pace.

Lovely shot. On a length, outside off, 140 kph, Mehidy drives this on the up, through the covers. That's how good the pitch is. Does not have enough timing to find the boundary but by the time sweeper cover can sweep the ball to his right, two runs are earned.
WIDE. Down the leg side, Mehidy Hasan Miraz misses his clip.
On a good length, outside off, Tawhid Hridoy chops it down to deep third for a single.
On the pads, clipped through square leg for a single.
Tossed up once more, pushed back to the bowler.
Outside off, pushed through the covers for one.
FOUR! IMPERIOUS! A boundary after 41 balls! Finally, the shackles are broken. Full, around middle and off, Mehidy Hasan Miraz gets down on a knee and sweeps it through mid-wicket for a boundary!
Around middle, Hridoy defends it to the leg side.
Tossed up, outside off, Tawhid Hridoy drives it towards long off for a single.
Short, outside off, Tawhid Hridoy cuts it through point for one.
Short again, Mehidy works it through mid-wicket for a run.
A short ball, worked wide of short mid-wicket for a single.
Fuller, around middle, Hridoy dances down the track but pushes it back to the bowler.
The dart, around middle, Mehidy Hasan Miraz defends.
Outside off, punched towards point for a single.
Googly, around middle, Mehidy looks to defend but gets a thick inside edge towards square leg. A WICKET MAIDEN for Wanindu Hasaranga and his bowling figures read 3-1-8-1!
Full, on middle, flicked towards short mid-wicket.

OUT! BOWLED! 'Wow'indu is amongst the wickets again! There was no boundary being scored for a while, for 30 balls, to be precise and Parvez Hossain Emon was itching to do something. This time, he just missed a straight ball though. Full, around off, coming in with the angle, Emon lunges to play the ball straight but just plays down the wrong line. The bat is around the middle stump while the ball lands outside off and comes in with the angle, to hit the off stump. Emon does not want to go but he is informed by the umpire that he is bowled and not stumped. Now, Emon starts to walk off. Departs for a fantastic 67 (69) and the 37-run stand is broken. Bangladesh are 110/3 after 19.4 overs!
Parvez Hossain Emon b W Hasaranga 67 (69b 6x4 3x6)
Clever bowling. A leg break, but bowled much slower through the air, outside off, Parvez looks to drive but misses.
Fuller, outside off, 83 kph, Emon gets well across his stumps to sweep but misses and is hit on the body.
Landed outside off, 81 kph, Parvez Hossain Emon goes back to cut but gets a bottom edge to the off side.
Outside off, this one suddenly lifts off a length. A surprised Hridoy just hangs his bat and the ball lobs up towards cover, but lands in front.
Excellent fielding. By Janith Liyanage again. Short and outside off, 94 kph, Tawhid Hridoy punches it behind point but Liyanage dives across to his left from point to make a clean stop.
Short again, punched through the covers for a single this time.
Another arm ball, outside off, 91 kph, shortish in length, Parvez goes back and punches it through the covers. By the time sweeper can get across to his left, the batters return for the second.
Landed outside off, 88 kph, Emon goes for an ambitious sweep but misses.
Short, outside off, Parvez Hossain Emon punches it straight to point.
Full, on middle, Tawhid Hridoy defends it to the leg side.
Outside off, eased through the covers for a run.

Beautifully bowled! Hasaranga switches to around the wicket and loops it up outside off. Emon lunges to defend, expecting the ball to turn in but the ball pitches and goes straight on, to beat the outside edge. Emon loses balance but manages to keep his back foot within the crease.
Outside off, Hridoy drives it through mid on for a run.
Appeal for LBW, but no conviction in it. A short ball, outside off, Tawhid Hridoy got down on a knee and looked to pull but misread the googly and got hit on the chest area. Height was the issue.
Full, on middle, Parvez Hossain Emon gets down and sweeps it through fine leg for a single.
Slows it down a touch, 87 kph, loops it up outside off, Hridoy watches it go past.
Short again, outside off, 91 kph, Parvez Hossain Emon backs away and punches it to deep point for one.
Outside off, short again, cut through cover for a run. The stand moves to 30 (31).
The arm ball, outside off, short in length, Tawhid Hridoy looks to cut but gets a bottom edge towards short third.
Around off, worked towards short mid-wicket.
Full, on middle, flicked through square leg for a single.
100 UP FOR BANGLADESH! At more than 6 runs per over. Short, outside off, this time TH backs away and connects with his cut to get it to the right of sweeper, for a couple.
Googly, short in length, Tawhid backs away to the leg side and looks to punch but is cramped for room and mistimes it back to the bowler.
Tossed up, around off, Tawhid Hridoy defends.
Outside off, pushed through mid off for one.
Around middle, pushed through mid on for a run.
A full toss, on middle, Parvez Hossain Emon leand and sweeps it through square leg for a single.
Full and outside off, Parvez Hossain Emon comes forward and slices it through covers for one more.
On the pads, defended back again towards the bowler.
Short and around off, Emon punches it back to the bowler.

FOUR! Streaky! Nagging length and just outside off, Parvez Hossain Emon tries to push it off the back foot without any foot movement. Gets a big outside edge that flies to the left of the keeper and goes to the deep third fence for a boundary.
Tossed it up and outside off, Tawhid Hridoy comes forward and pushes it towards cover, who dives to his left but can't cut it off. A single taken.
Begins with a short delivery, outside off, Emon goes back and cuts it through cover point for one.

A tight single! On the pads, Parvez Hossain Emon eases out beside the pitch on the leg side and sets off for a quick single. Asalanka runs across to his left and gets to the ball to throw it to the non-striker's end but misses. They complete the single.
Full and around off, Emon drives it straight back to the bowler, who leaps and plucks it on the bounce with his right hand.
Nagging length and outside off, Tawhid Hridoy punches it through covers for a single.
Touch short and outside off, Emon slices it to deep point for one.

FOUR! FIFTY FOR PARVEZ HOSSAIN EMON! Floated up and around off, Emon goes across on his knees and drags it with a sweep shot over square leg for a boundary to complete his milestone. A class inning from the youngster. His maiden half century in this format, in just his second game.
SIX! Powerfully struck! Tossed it up and around off, Parvez Hossain Emon goes on his knees, gets underneath it and muscles it between long on and deep mid-wicket for a biggie.
On the shorter side and outside off, Hridoy cuts it but straight to backward point. Just 2 runs off it.
Keeps it shorter and around off, Tawhid Hridoy nudges it to mid-wicket again but off the back foot this time.
Dunith Wellalage drags his length as he sees the batter, Tawhid Hridoy, advancing down the track and bowls it around middle. Hridoy adjusts his shot and clips it to mid-wicket.
On the pads, nudged away to the right of short fine leg for a single by Emon.
Dragged length and around off, Parvez Hossain Emon taps it towards backward point and wants to have a single but is sent back.
Flatter, full and around off, Tawhid Hridoy flicks it to deep square leg for one.
Tossed it up and outside off, Parvez Hossain Emon comes forward and drops it down towards extra cover. Just a run and a wicket from the over, Charith Asalanka's bowling figures read 2-0-11-1.
Touch short again and around off, Parvez Hossain Emon blocks it towards square leg off the back foot.
Nagging length and around off, Tawhid Hridoy slices it to deep point for one off the back foot to get off the mark.

OUT! CAUGHT! Charith Asalanka strikes and this is big wicket for Sri Lanka. Najmul Hossain Shanto can't believe what he has done here. Dragged length and darting in around the middle stump, Shanto goes back, opens his stance, and tries to pull it over cow corner. He mistimes it as the ball has got too close to his body and hence, he doesn't get the desired elevation. It goes towards wide long on, where Maheesh Theekshana runs across to his left and pouches this catch while running. Shanto departs for 14 (19) and the budding 63-run stand has been broken. Bangladesh are 73/2 after 11.3 overs.
Najmul Hossain Shanto c M Theekshana b C Asalanka 14 (19b 2x4 0x6)
Nagging length and around off, Shanto presses back and pushes it to mid off.
Slower and drifting around middle, Najmul Hossain Shanto blocks it off the front foot.
Hard length and outside off, Najmul Hossain Shanto gets top on the bounce and punches it through covers for one more.
Nagging length and outside off, Emon drives it to the right of mid off for a quick single.

FOUR BYES! Beats everyone! A bouncer, around off, Parvez Hossain Emon hops up and looks to slice it over point but misses. Even the keeper, Kusal Mendis, leaps with his extended right arm to collect it behind the stumps but fails to get it. The ball crosses everyone and goes to the boundary.
Back of a length and outside off, offers width, Shanto rises with the bounce and runs it down to deep third for one more.
