Full and around off, Parvez Hossain Emon looks to punch it on the up to the off side but gets it off the inner half of the bat. Beats the diving mid-wicket to his right and takes a single.
Hard length and just outside off, Parvez Hossain Emon stands tall and looks to punch but ends chopping it out into the pitch off the inner half of the bat.
Nagging length and around off, Parvez Hossain Emon looks to drive but gets it off the inner half of the bat towards mid-wicket. A single taken. Bangladesh are 65/1 after Powerplay 1.

FOUR! Top shot! Fuller and on the pads, from around the wicket, Parvez Hossain Emon goes across on his knees and drags it with a sweep shot towards square leg, who goes across to stop but lets it through between his hands for a boundary.
Dragged length and outside off, slower too, Parvez Hossain Emon waits for it and cuts it hard but can't find the gap, as the ball goes straight to backward point.

FOUR! That previous ball brought about this shot. With no turn on offer, Emon gets a big stride, fetches the ball from almost a short of full length and sweeps it through square leg for a boundary. Moves to 32 (33) with this third four and it also brings up the 50-RUN STAND IN 43 BALLS!
Landed outside off, left alone. No turn there.
Tossed up, around off, Najmul Hossain Shanto leans and drives it towards long off for a single.

FOUR! Deft touch! A bit fuller than the previous one and a similar line, down the leg side, Parvez Hossain Emon leans onto it and just tickles it fine to deep fine leg for a boundary to end the over. A big one for Bangladesh as 11 came off it.

Nagging length and seaming in but on the pads, Parvez Hossain Emon is drawn forward as he goes to flick it but misses. Gets hit on the front pad and the ball rolls away beside the pitch on the leg side.

SIX! Whacked! Back of a length and down the leg side, Parvez Hossain Emon swivels on his toes, and hooks it over the deep fine leg fence for a biggie. He is starting to opening up. 50 UP FOR BANGLADESH!
Outside off, Emon looks to cut but gets a bottom edge towards point.
Beaten! Excellent delivery. Back of a length, around middle and leg, Parvez Hossain Emon looks to defend but the ball pitches and then moves away, squaring him up. Beats the outside edge.

Janith Liyanage again. What a fielder this guy is. His face reminds me of the great Romesh Kaluwitharana, who was a great keeper himself. Full, on middle, Najmul Hossain Shanto drives this straight down the ground, through mid on. But Liyanage races across to his right from mid on and slides beautifully to stop the ball cleanly. Just a single.

SIX! TONKED! Theekshana tosses it up and keeps it around off, Parvez Hossain Emon goes across on his knees, gets it in his radar, and slog-sweeps it over deep mid-wicket for a biggie. First of the match!
Flatter, full and around middle, Parvez Hossain Emon plants his front leg forward and shows the full face of the bat to block it right under his eyes.
Fuller and on the pads, Najmul Hossain Shanto leans onto and knocks it down to long on for one.
A touch short, around off, 103 kph, moving away with the angle, Najmul stays back and defends.
Full and straight, watchfully defended this time.
Fuller, around off, 102 kph, Shanto looks to play straight but gets the ball off the inner half of the bat, towards short mid-wicket.
WIDE. Down the leg side, too quick again, Najmul Hossain Shanto cannot get it away.
Another short delivery, but on leg this time, Parvez Hossain Emon sways away from it too. A fiery over comes to an end from Dushmantha Chameera.

FOUR BYES! A bumper that goes over the head of the batter, Parvez Hossain Emon, who ducks underneath it. The keeper Kusal Mendis leaps with his extended right arm but fails to collect it. The ball goes over him for a boundary.

Uppish! Full and seaming in, around middle, Parvez Hossain Emon comes forward and shows the full face of the bat to drive. Gets it aerially towards mid on, where Janith Liyanage slides to his right and stops it. Liyanage was impressive in the first ODI as well, taking that brilliant catch at mid off, to get rid of Tanzid Hasan.
WIDE! Sprays it down the leg side and on the back of a length, Parvez Hossain Emon swings at it in order to flick it but misses. Called a wide.
More swing on offer, from middle stump, towards leg stump, Parvez falls over in his attempt to flick but manages to hit the ball towards mid-wicket.
Fuller, around middle, hint of inswing, Emon looks to drive straight but gets it off the inner half of the bat towards mid on.
WIDE. Down the leg side, left alone.
Full, around off, moving away, Parvez Hossain Emon defends.
Touch short and around off, Parvez Hossain Emon presses back and punches it to the left of the bowler. Gets a single as the mid off fielder cuts it off.
Nagging length and on the pads, Parvez Hossain Emon eases out to the left of square leg now, who collects it by moving there. Another dot.

Switches to around the wicket and bowls a flatter delivery, around middle, Parvez Hossain Emon comes forward and tucks it to square leg. Najmul Hossain Shanto wants to have a single but Emon shouts a big 'No'.
A touch short, punched towards long on for one more.
Fuller, outside off, Emon punches it through the right of mid off but cannot get it through. Good fielding by Nishan Madushka getting across and putting the dive, keeping the batters to a single.
On a length, drifting away, Parvez Hossain Emon punches it straight to point.
Outside off, slanting away, left alone. 10 from that over. The most expensive one of the innings so far.
Down the leg side, tucked towards square leg.

MISFIELD, FOUR! Clumsy from Maheesh Theekshana. A length ball, down the leg side, Najmul Hossain Shanto tucks it straight to short fine leg. He wants a single but is sent back. However, Theekshana dives over the ball and it goes through for a boundary!
Slower ball again, on a length, around middle and leg, Parvez Hossain Emon tucks it towards short mid-wicket.
Full and outside off, pushed towards point.

EDGED, FOUR! Doesn't matter how they come, as far as Bangladesh are concerned. A short ball, around leg and middle, Emon swings wildly but is beaten for pace again. The ball comes ever so slowly, takes the top edge and flies over the keeper to the deep third fence.
Outside off, lack of pace, pushed towards point. The siren goes off booming, which could mean only one thing - Asitha has overstepped and it has been signalled a NO BALL. Free Hit coming up!
Full and outside off, defended solidly.
Another dart, swinging away, tucked towards short fine leg where Asitha Fernando fumbles and concedes a single. Hurts his finger as well.
Down the leg side, tucked through square leg for a couple.

Huge appeal for LBW! Nothing from the umpire. Maheesh Theekshana is literally pleading with the umpire but to the naked eye, that seemed to be going past the off stump. The Lankans have a chat and keeper Kusal Mendis seems to be the most animated and eventually, convinces skipper Asalanka to take the review. It was a very full ball, around middle and off, and Parvez Hossain Emon got low to sweep the ball on a knee, but missed it and was hit on the pads. UltraEdge does not detect anything when the ball is near the bat. As expected, Ball Tracking shows the ball to be going past the off stump.
Outside off, another missile, pushed into the off side.
Full and outside off, plenty of drift, defended.
Outside off, slanting away, let through. 4 runs and a wicket from the over, Asitha Fernando's bowling figures read 2-0-10-1.

FOUR! Lovely ball, even better shot. Asitha targets the boots and tries to bring the ball swing into the left hander, almost around the yorker length. But gets it too full, around middle. However, Shanto is upto it and flicks it through mid-wicket for a classical boundary to get off the mark in style.

A short ball, outside leg, Najmul Hossain Shanto just about gets across and lets it pass. He expects a wide call but doesn't get it. The umpire explains that had he stayed where he was, the ball would have hit him and hence the call.

OUT! CAUGHT BEHIND! As always, more often than not, Asitha strikes first. It is the knuckle delivery, landing around middle and off on a length. Tanzid Hasan looks to cut it through the off side but the ball swings away from the left hander and also, arrives a lot slower than he anticipated. The shot is already through before the ball could come and all the batter manages is a thick outside edge behind. The keeper, Kusal Mendis, dives in front to pouch that catch and Sri Lanka have their first wicket. Tanzid, who looked the most fluent from Bangladesh's side in the first ODI, departs for just  7 (11) and Bangladesh are 10/1 after 2.3 overs!
Tanzid Hasan c K Mendis b A Fernando 7 (11b 0x4 0x6)

Full and down the leg side, swinging further down, Tanzid looks to flick but misses and is hit on the pads. Asitha appeals but the umpire shakes his head. There is a bit of a chat between the Lankans but they don't take the review.
Pace off, on a length, outside off, Tanzid Hasan steers it straight to point.

Excellent effort from Pathum Nissanka. Down the leg side, Tanzid works this through square leg. The ball races away but Nissanka hares across to his left from sweeper, getting to the ball just before it can touch the ropes. Dives and pushes it away, saving a run for his side.
Pretty quick, 101.1 kph, plenty of drift away from the left hander, quite full, Hasan defends.
Pitching outside leg stump, Tanzid Hasan looks to flick but misses and is hit on the pads.
A touch short, on the leg stump, tucked to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Down the leg side, worked straight to short fine leg.
Full and outside off, drifting away with the angle, Parvez Hossain Emon looks to drive but gets a thick outside edge towards point.
Full and straight, watchfully defended.
On middle and leg, heaved over mid-wicket for a brace.
Full and around off, watchfully blocked out.
LBW appeal turned down. No thought about the review. On a length, around leg stump, Hasan looked to heave it across but missed and was hit high on the pads. Height and pitching were the issues.
WIDE. Hint of swing, but misdirected. Down the leg side, Tanzid misses his flick.
Similar ball, worked a touch squarer on the leg side this time. Fine leg gets across and makes a half stop, which allows the second run.
Full and down the leg side, Parvez Hossain Emon flicks it to deep mid-wicket for a single to get the scoreboard rolling.
